slides.title: Welcome to Ecosystems
slides.content:
# Introduction to Ecosystems

Welcome to **Ecosystems** - understanding natural systems!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Ecosystem Components** - Biotic and abiotic
- **Energy Flow** - Food webs and trophic levels
- **Nutrient Cycling** - Matter movement
- **Ecosystem Services** - Benefits to humans

> **Fun Fact:** Rainforests produce 20% of Earth's oxygen!

slides.title: Ecosystem Structure
slides.content:
# Ecosystem Structure

## Components:

### Biotic (Living):
- Producers (autotrophs)
- Consumers (heterotrophs)
- Decomposers

### Abiotic (Non-living):
- Sunlight, water, temperature
- Soil, nutrients, oxygen

## Trophic Levels:

| Level | Organisms |
|-------|----------|
| Producer | Plants, algae |
| Primary consumer | Herbivores |
| Secondary consumer | Carnivores |
| Tertiary consumer | Top predators |
| Decomposer | Fungi, bacteria |

slides.title: Energy Flow
slides.content:
# Energy Flow

## Food Chains and Webs:
- Energy flows one direction
- Matter cycles

## 10% Rule:
- Only 10% energy transfers up
- 90% lost as heat
- Limits food chain length

## Productivity:

| Type | Definition |
|------|------------|
| GPP | Total energy captured |
| NPP | GPP - respiration |

## Biomass Pyramids:
- Usually upright
- Less biomass at higher levels

slides.title: Ecosystems Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Approximately what percentage of energy transfers between trophic levels?

slides.title: Ecosystem Services
slides.content:
# Ecosystem Services

## Categories:

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Provisioning | Food, water, materials |
| Regulating | Climate, water purification |
| Supporting | Nutrient cycling, soil formation |
| Cultural | Recreation, aesthetics |

## Economic Value:
- Pollination: billions annually
- Water purification: saves treatment costs
- Carbon storage: climate mitigation

## Threats:
- Habitat destruction
- Pollution
- Climate change
- Overexploitation

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Ecosystems Summary

## Structure:
- Biotic + Abiotic components
- Producers, consumers, decomposers

## Energy:
- Flows one way
- 10% transfer per level
- NPP = available for consumers

## Services:
| Type | Benefit |
|------|--------|
| Provisioning | Resources |
| Regulating | Climate, water |
| Supporting | Cycles |
| Cultural | Recreation |
